title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
* Experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field
* Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
* Experience in business or financial analysis
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
* Experience with Excel
* Experience with SQL
* Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Ring Europe is looking for a talented marketing analyst, capable of discovering new data insights, designing key KPIs, creating impactful data visualization and bringing our marketing analytics to the next level.
  
  

As our Marketing analyst, you will be responsible for key analytical projects and business intelligence in the marketing domain. You will have hands-on experience in digital marketing platforms such as Google, Meta and Bing and are knowledgeable about the latest developments in SEO and digital ads in the industry. You are a marketer at heart but you are also a data expert, writing complex database queries to explore internal / external data sources in order to validate business hypotheses.
  
  

This role resides in the BI and Analytics team. You will closely co-work with the Marketing and Business Development teams, along with other business stakeholders, ensuring that Ring optimises its marketing investment to achieve the best return.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
Working closely with the marketing, web analytics and business development teams, you will solve unique analytical problems and find answers to questions that require tenacious problem-solving skills and creativity.
  
  

**What You'll Do:**  

* Enhance existing marketing measurement and design KPIs to best measure marketing effectiveness and budget efficiency
* Collaborate closely with the marketing team to dive deep into areas such as SEO, funnel analysis and attribution models that will enhance marketing performance using data analytics; then make actionable recommendations
* Research industry best practices, the latest tracking trends (such as cookies) and analytical measurement tools
* Create and maintain marketing-related Tableau dashboards
* Work with the data engineering team to maintain and enhance the internal marketing data platform and data models
* Explore and review internal and external marketing data sources to ensure data quality; devise mechanisms and tools to monitor data integrity on a large scale
* Conduct ad hoc research and root cause analyses in fields such as user behaviour and web traffic
* Assist with preparing quarterly business review documents
* Coordinate & facilitate data supply to CMO
* Experience in financial/business analysis


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Sales Order Services Coordinator
description:
### **Basic Information**

Country:


Netherlands
State:


NA
City:


Amsterdam
Date Published:


27-Jun-2024
Job ID:


42060
Travel:


up to 10%
  
### **Description and Requirements**

CareerArc Code


CA-LJ
**"At BMC trust is not just a word - it's a way of life!"**

  

  

  

We are an award-winning, equal opportunity, culturally diverse, fun place to be. Giving back to the community drives us to be better every single day. Our work environment allows you to balance your priorities, because we know you will bring your best every day. We will champion your wins and shout them from the rooftops. Your peers will inspire, drive, support you, and make you laugh out loud!  

  

  

We help our customers free up time and space to become an Autonomous Digital Enterprise that conquers the opportunities ahead - and are relentless in the pursuit of innovation!
BMC’s dynamic corporate teams are strategic and trusted advisors to the global organization supporting, enhancing, and driving BMC’s vision, culture, growth, and so much more. Each individual within the corporate teams is a valued partner to the overarching success of BMC’s employees and customers If you are looking for a company that gives you the freedom to expand your role, focuses highly on your professional development through continuous enablement, gives you an environment where you would feel happy to come to work, then BMC is the place to be.
Who we are and what we do  

We’re not new to the world of IT management solutions and services, but our attitude is. We have the clout of proven market leadership. But we also have the energy, optimism, opportunities and private financial backing that makes us feel and act more like a start-up that knows no limits.  

For you, that means the chance to do more and be more, not only making incredible things happen with technology but also reinventing the BMC business right now.  

A career that expands your mind and your horizons. Peers who inspire you, drive you, support you, and make you laugh out loud. An environment that fosters individuality and personal growth. All at a company that is committed to leading the industry in the delivery of digital services for business transformation. That’s BMC.  

What the analysts say
We can talk about being best in class, but it means much more when you hear it from unbiased third parties. Gartner and Forrester continually place us ahead of our primary competitors.  

What we offer* We hire the best performers in every area, people who are the perfect blend of competitive and supportive to help you succeed in your career.
* You’ll work in a sales order team which is known for its excellence in delivery.
* We have a compensation structure designed for high performers, with all the perks you’d expect and some that will surprise you.
* We want our people to be the best in their fields, and we offer unbeatable training and growth opportunities.
* We foster a culturally diverse, dynamic, and fun working environment—our employees’ comfort and quality of life are critical to company success.
* We’ve created flexible workspaces that encourage creativity and teamwork—including work-from-home opportunities for those who want them.
* We give our employees outstanding benefits that allow you to make strategic choices for you and your family.

  

As a Order Services Coordinator you’ll be responsible for:* Order Processing – Conduct transactional and contractual review, validate and enter all orders ensuring data accuracy for proper revenue flow.
* Working flexible hours due to a fluctuating business environment.
* Ensure orders are compliant to the established licensing policies in accordance with Corporate, SOX, Revenue Recognition and/or US-Gaap policies and procedures
* Drives and participates in resolving order issues and proactively communicates with SOS, Field Sales and/or managers on order issues and keep them informed of any problems resolving issues
* Support sales (through SOS) on customer identification, customer inventory identification, (renewal)quote preparation related to commercial, legal or Rev Rec policies
* Develop & maintain a detailed working knowledge of Revenue Recognition and Revenue Accounting policies concerning the licensing of software & support applicable to the Order to Cash process
* Is involved or conducts audits of sales orders in Oracle for proper revenue allocations
* Prepares and provides customer invoices, addresses and resolve invoicing issues
* Creates Maintenance (support) credits
* Processes contractual documentation; ensure all required documentation are present and monitor originals
* Communicates products and shipping concerns to product marketing operations and product distributions
* Communicates application or process defects to appropriate IT and business process owners
* Develops and maintains effective communication with sales team, Order Services teams, commissions or accounting teams to enable problem resolution
* May be involved in design and acceptance testing of BMC Order Services applications
* Create process documents and amend existing processes documents to drive consistency

To be a successful Order Services Coordinator we ideally look for:* Minimum of 2 to 5 years’ experience in a similar job of customer support, sales support or functional coordinator role
* Degree graduate in a business or IT discipline.
* Strong knowledge of the EMEA region, having worked with an EMEA scope.
* Knowledge and experience with license and/or software accounting, legal operations, and understanding of license revenue recognition requirements.
* Large, multinational company business experience required
* Knowledge of and proven experience in relevant domains
* Demonstrated experience in influencing and managing change
* Demonstrated ability to work in a team in a very dynamic and virtual environment
* Ability to work in flexible working hours
* Proficiency in a foreign language is a plus

**Our commitment to you!**

  



BMC’s culture is built around its people. We have 6000+ brilliant minds working together across the globe. You won’t be known just by your employee number, but for your true authentic self. BMC lets you be YOU!

  



If after reading the above, You’re unsure if you meet the qualifications of this role but are deeply excited about BMC and this team, we still encourage you to apply! We want to attract talents from diverse backgrounds and experience to ensure we face the world together with the best ideas!

  



BMC is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, age, sex, creed, color, religion, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy, disabled veteran or status as a protected veteran. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, visit the accommodation request page.

title: QC Laborant - Chemisch Analist
description:
Corbion creëert duurzame ingrediënten op basis van natuurlijke grondstoffen. Zo leveren we een bijdrage aan het behoud van voedsel en voedselproductie, gezondheid en onze planeet.

  

In onze fabriek in Gorinchem worden voedselingrediënten en biochemicaliën geproduceerd op basis van natuurlijke en duurzame grondstoffen. Het Quality Control team is verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteitscontrole van de eindproducten van de 10 verschillende productielijnen. Je werkt hier onder leiding van de QC Manager samen met 17 andere QC professionals , waarvan een gedeelte in dagdienst werkt en een deel dat een vol continu ploegenrooster aanhoudt. Het team kenmerkt zich door een open en vriendschappelijke sfeer waar hard in wordt samengewerkt om doelen te bereiken.  

  

De Technician A houdt zich voornamelijk bezig met het uitvoeren van analyses op monsters van grondstoffen, halffabricaten, eindproducten en monsters ter ondersteuning van projecten.  

  

**Verantwoordelijkheden**  

  

* Uitvoeren van chemische, fysische, microbiologische en instrumentele analyses op grondstoffen, procesmonsters en eindproducten
* Het kritisch beoordelen van resultaten en trends, verwerking van data via LIMS en Qi analist
* Het onderhouden en kalibreren van instrumenten
 **Functie-eisen**  

  

* Afgeronde MBO-4 opleiding richting analytische chemie
* Kennis van en ervaring met GMP/ISO
* Werken in teamverband
* Kennis van analyse technieken als Titratie, HPLC, ICP, GLC
* Goede contactuele eigenschappen
* Nauwkeurig kunnen werken
  

Nadruk in deze functie ligt op routinematig analytisch werk en ondersteuning bieden aan Technician B.  

  

**Ons aanbod**  

  

Wij bieden een marktconforme beloning en goede arbeidsvoorwaarden. Wat Corbion speciaal maakt, is de manier waarop we bewust het verband creëren tussen onze resultaten en onze individuele levens. Wij gebruiken dit om als bedrijf de juiste keuzes te maken en om prioriteiten te stellen. We hebben een geweldig bedrijf dat bestaat uit getalenteerde, toegewijde mensen - mensen die een doel en een visie delen. Als we allemaal dezelfde ambitie hebben, zijn de mogelijkheden onbeperkt. Wij bieden jou de kans om je aan te sluiten bij een bedrijf met een:  

  

* Cultuur die zich kenmerkt door mensen in hun kracht te zetten en waar jouw initiatieven en ideeën echt verschil maken
* Internationale focus met een grote diversiteit aan teams
* Unieke mogelijkheid om getraind te worden door onze interne experts in de wereld van duurzame producten.
  

Tenslotte bieden wij een vriendelijke, informele cultuur binnen een veeleisende en professionele omgeving  

Daarnaast omarmen wij de diversiteit in onze samenwerking, dit maakt onderdeel uit van onze gedeelde doelstellingen en waarden. Door je te verbinden aan Corbion, word je een medewerker in een bedrijf waar je trots kunt zijn op jouw prestaties. Wij bieden jou de kans om jouw carrière verder te ontwikkelen met wereldwijde vooruitzichten.

 **Over Corbion**


Corbion is de wereldwijde marktleider op het gebied van melkzuur en melkzuurderivaten en een vooraanstaand leverancier van emulgatoren, functionele enzymenmixen, mineralen, vitamines en uit algen gewonnen ingrediënten. Onze oplossingen voegen onderscheidende functionaliteiten toe aan producten in markten zoals voeding, huishoudelijke producten, persoonlijke verzorging, diervoeding, geneesmiddelen, medische implantaten en bioplastics. Met een wereldwijd netwerk van productielocaties, verkoopkantoren en -agenten in meer dan 100 landen, staat Corbion zowel bekend om kwaliteit, innovatie en klantgerichtheid als om de informele en collegiale bedrijfscultuur.

***Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.***

title: Staff Software Engineer (Backend)
description:
**About JWP:**



JWP is the leading video software and data insights platform that gives our customers independence and control in today's Digital Video Economy. Founded over a decade ago as an open-source video player, JWP's technology platform now powers digital video for hundreds of thousands of businesses across NA, EMEA, APAC, and LATAM. Each month, there are over 1 billion viewers across 2.7 billion unique devices consuming video on JWP's technology.


**Remote Policy:**



At JWP, we have adopted a remote work policy, with all our employees working remotely. While we value remote work, we can only consider candidates who are currently located within the country of the job posting. Regrettably, candidates outside of the country of posting will not be considered, and JWP does not provide relocation assistance. This policy is aligned with our operational setup.


**The Engineering Team:**



Our Engineering team plays a big part in the company's success through the development of innovative technologies. Engineers at JWP are passionate about writing code and solving complex problems. Equipped with a modern tech stack, our Engineers contribute to helping drive monetization for our customers across billions of devices monthly.


**The Opportunity:**



Backend Engineers at JWP contribute to the development of innovative video-focused technology products that service clients around the world. We are looking for an experienced Backend Engineer to join our team in the Netherlands. This is a Staff level opportunity to come on board to use modern technology stacks and work on interesting products within the video space that impact clients across some of the many verticals, such as broadcasting and publishing.


**As a Staff Software Engineer for our Authorization Service, you will:**


* Build a delivery system that can deliver personalized and recommended video metadata at scale.
* Build a system that helps broadcasters to manage their OTT applications across different platforms.
* Optimize the architecture of our delivery services.
* Design the data models and data solutions that we need to power our services.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional team focused on our customers and their viewers experiences.
* Contribute to innovative technology and architecture of a global production-scale service layer.
* Work with microservices and microservice principles (Service discovery, API gateways, data transaction consistency, etc.).
* Make a material impact on our streaming products, analytics, and OTT integrations.
* Participate in code reviews with and mentor your peers.


**Requirements for the role:**


* At least 7 years of relevant experience, with an extensive background in backend development.
* Demonstrable experience of leading technical projects and architecting solutions.
* Proven record of leading cross-team technical projects and architecting and delivering high-quality and impactful technical solutions, demonstrating expertise independent of programming languages.
* Demonstrated experience in scaling systems to the next level to handle increased loads and demands.
* In-depth knowledge of database types, database design and data structures.
* Commitment to code quality, maintainability, readability, scalability, and performance.
* Ability to quickly analyze and resolve tactical issues across various areas.
* Experience mentoring junior engineers.
* Open-minded and eager to learn new technologies.


**Bonus Points:**


* Experience working with OTT apps/platforms or worked in the broadcasters' industry.
* Solid understanding of the Python programming language.
* Experience building scalable systems using cloud infrastructures like AWS or Google Cloud.
* Understand micro-services architecture: Designing, creating, deploying, testing, and monitoring.
* Contributed to open-source projects.
* Experience with K8s, Docker and Containers.


**Perks of being at JWP,** **Netherlands**



Our goal is to take care of you and ensure you will be successful in your new role. Your success is our success!



As a full time employee, you will qualify for:


* Competitive Paid Time Off
* Stock Options Purchase Plan
* Retirement / Pension Plan
* New Employee Home Office Setup Stipend
* Monthly Connectivity Stipend
* Quarterly and Annual Team Events - *because team building is important!*
* Professional Career Program and Career Development Opportunities
* Bi-Annual Hack Weeks for those who are interested in using their coding knowledge
* Fireside chats with individuals at JWP


* *Benefits are subject to location and can change at the discretion of the Company.*


**Check out our social channels:**

  



*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, and/or disability status.*

title: Internship Finance & CX Data Analytics
description:
Are you a driven student with a passion for data and finance? Join CBS at PostNL as a Finance & Customer Experience (CX) Data Analytics Intern and make a real impact on our data quality and business insights!  

  

**Uitdagingen**  


The business intelligence and analytics team (BI&A) wants to improve the transparency and quality of the data. This requires an analytical mindset and a curious attitude. You will be part of a team that is crucial to making this project a success. The Analytics team has ambitions to help PostNL in creating a data foundation and the quality of the data ingested is crucial for achieving this objective and improve our logistics.


As an intern, your main assignment will be researching the datasets that are part of our ingestion pipeline. You will analyze and shape data quality rules to apply. This will require your own research but you will have the support of the business partners. The goal is to generate the right metrics that will help us in measuring the healthiness of our data.  

Although you’ll have the support of the team and experienced engineers, this position will require self-initiative and ability to learn. The bases are set for a solid start but you will have the opportunity to bring your ideas and knowledge with you.


**Furthermore, in this role you will:**


* Ensure data quality and integrity across various financial and customer experience datasets.
* Support the team in various data-driven projects and initiatives.
* Utilize tools like Python, PowerBI, and SQL to extract, analyze, and visualize data.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven improvements.
* Research datasets within our ingestion pipeline and shape data quality rules.
* Generate metrics to measure the healthiness of our data with support from business partners.

  

  

**Je verantwoordelijkheden**  

**Visible work:** Join PostNL as a Finance & CX Data Analytics Intern and play a key role in enhancing our data quality and business insights. You'll gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge tools like Python, PowerBI, and SQL while working alongside a dedicated analytics team.


**Challenge:** You will help to transform complex financial and customer experience data into actionable insights.


**Good atmosphere:** You work together with colleagues who dare to seize opportunities and help each other move forward.


**Freedom:** You work Hybrid and at our vibrant, state-of-the-art office in the historic Station Post Building (next to Holland Spoor)


**Development Opportunities:** You will have plenty of opportunities to develop yourself and grow into other roles or departments.  



  

  

**Wat breng jij mee?**  


We are looking for someone who is currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field. You should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as these are essential for turning complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and Python is important, as you will be using these tools regularly.  

In addition to technical skills, excellent communication and teamwork abilities are crucial. You will be working closely with other team members and stakeholders, so being able to clearly convey your findings and collaborate effectively is key. We also value an eagerness to learn and contribute to the team. If you are enthusiastic about data and driven to make an impact, you will fit right in with our dynamic and supportive work environment.

  

  

**In summary, we strongly encourage you to apply for this internship if you bring the following points with you:**


* Currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python).
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* You are available for a period of 4-6 months from September 2024 onwards.

  

**Wat bezorgen we jou?**  


An innovative internship and work that affects literally every street in the country. PostNL wants to be the logistics e-commerce platform of the future, delivering special moments faster, smarter and better. With your mindset, you can help PostNL face its challenges head on. You can count on excellent benefits in the process.


**The top benefits of your position are:**


* Hybrid working is encouraged and you’ll have flexible working hours. After all, your work-life balance matters to us;
* A dynamic and supportive working environment;
* Reimbursement of commuting expenses;
* Training and development opportunities through the PostNL Academy;
* A compeititve internship allowance of €500 based on a 40-hour working week;


.

title: Business Engineer – Improvement Engineering
description:
**Introduction to the job**


The focus of the semiconductor industry (and other industries simultaneously) is more and more on a green environment and circular economy. ASML is committed to play a strong role in this. Are you triggered by this, do you want to contribute to a greener environment while working in a multinational in the semiconductor business?


Do you have strong data analytic background? Do you want to contribute to transform waste to valuable reusable material ? We are looking for people like you to join our Improvement Engineering group in Reuse engineering

**Job Mission**


 The Improvement engineering group in Re-Use Engineering department, In this role you translate data to information to support correct business decision making in the R&R engineering department.

**Job Description**  

Your main responsibilities are:

* Analyze business insight/performance/requests to translate the information to actionable improvement solution proposal.
* Support decision making process for solution provider selections
* Consult business insight developer with business knowledge on data.
* Think along and drive improvement solution with reuse engineering staffs and project leads
* Interface with internal & external customers to collect their demand and translate it to requirement. Recommend how the requirement can be translated to usable business insight.
* Maintain and secure data integrity of analysis and report.

**Education and experience**

* BS degree in Data Science, Analytics, Engineering, Business, Finance, Computer Science or equivalent education experience.
* 3+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst/Analytics Developer including experience building Analytical products for internal consumption (E.g. Dashboards, automatic analysis, algorithms,).
* Experienced with IT-systems in the area of production-control, preferably with Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI (Excel, SAP, SAP ME/BO, SAP HANA), SQL, Python and Alteryx
* Experience with advanced analytics (e.g. Process Mining, Machine Learning, AI, Imagine recognition, etc)
* Stakeholder management.
* Experience within semi-conductor industry including ASML experience is a plus.

**Skills**


 Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.  

To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

* Proactive and Pragmatic, likes to challenge the status quo
* Strong analytical capability
* To be flexible and enjoy working in a rapidly changing environment
* Team player with excellent communication skills in a multicultural work environment
* Enjoy working with various stakeholders both worldwide and cross sector
* Strong drive and able to influence stakeholders without power
* Flexibly change needed role between expert and leader and accept needed work per situations

**Other information**


 Please submit your CV and motivation letter when applying for this role.


The Business Engineer works in small expert teams closely working with field and cross sector stakeholders, reporting to Improvement Engineering Manager, flexibility in assignment/projects is required as the Re-Use scope is developing/growing over time


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our **frequently asked questions**

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. title: Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape
description:
**Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape**  

What if your expertise as a Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape would help build the data foundation needed to create state of the art predictive models supporting our business and customers every single day? What if your knowledge, skills, and enthusiasm would contribute directly to the success of a global company?



You bridge the gap between business, data and technology. You identify the needs for data of the data scientists and translate them into the right data products.



You will be working in an international team of professionals that have a true passion for what they do. DLL is an IRB financial institution with a unique combination of great opportunities, short reporting lines and broad responsibilities. Data is essential to everything we do, and we rely on dedicated teams of specialists, from data collection to modelling, validation to model implementation. Collaboration is the tool we use to achieve our goals and ambitions. Together, through diversity and inclusion, we will become better at what we do.



Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL

 **Day to day:**  

* As a Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape, you are responsible for the availability and quality of the data for our Risk- and Non-Regulatory Models.
* Together with the team of modelers you decide what data is necessary to successfully develop a model.
* You will investigate if the requested data is already available on the Azure Data Platform.
* If not, you will work closely together with departments in different countries to collect and test the data.
* You will also work closely together with IT to automate the onboarding of the data on the Azure data platform from different applications.
* Next step is to test the quality of the data. If necessary, you will initiate actions together with IT and the application owners to improve the data quality.
* If the necessary data is available and of good quality, you are responsible to transform the data into an integrated model dataset and make it available to the modelers.
* This is an iterative process until the model meets the required performance.
* Together with the team, you are responsible for the data on the data platform and help ensure that there is proper governance around changes in the model data landscape.
* You will also support documentation of data collection and testing activities as well as validation of these activities by the Model Validation team where needed.
* You will provide guidance and support to less experienced team members in the above areas.
* You will, in the above activities, interact with stakeholders from many different teams/departments, such as Predictive Modeling, Data Management, (local) Finance, Sales, and IT.
* You will report to the manager Data Analytics.


**All members enjoy**

* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”

 **Essentials:**  

* A Bachelor or Master’s degree in a data- or IT-related field
* 5 - 10 years of professional experience working in a similar role
* Understanding data is a true passion of yours
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Proven experience in executing quantitative analyses using SQL and R/Python, and ability to work with MS Excel
* You have a good eye for detail and strong interpersonal skills
* Demonstrated affinity with the development of predictive models
* You are a self-starter and able to work in an organization with a complex system and data landscape
* Strong analytical and project management skills.


**Extras:**


* Knowledge and experience with the application of Agile and Scrum practices
* Experience in working with Microsoft Azure technology and Databricks
* Prior experience working in the Finance industry / credit risk domain and knowledge of relevant regulation
* Preference to work in a dynamic, international environment.

  

**Choose wellbeing**  

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.



Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:


* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL

 **Settling in**  

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.



But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.



Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.



Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.



We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**

 **Good to know:**  

* Deadline for application: July 21st (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #LI-NA1
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Natascha Hooi via natascha.hooi@dllgroup.com.


DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.



DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

  

Job Reference: DLL NL02684

title: Technical Supplier Manager D&E Machine Conditioning
description:
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------


ASML supports the semiconductor industry’s ongoing quest for producing faster, smarter and more energy efficient chips. ASML creates lithographic systems that the semiconductor industry needs to achieve these goals. Our success as a company depends on strong cooperation between ASML and our suppliers.


Are you experienced in proactively managing suppliers? Do you understand product design of high-tech machinery? Would you like to help develop the supplier to be ready to engage with the industrialization of our future products? Do you like to take ownership to ensure suppliers deliver the right quality on time? Would you like to further develop your result driven approach and your excellent stakeholder management skills? Do you have experience with Lean Six Sigma and Statistical Process Control (SPC)? If so, we are looking for you!

**Mission**


The Technical Supplier Manager (TSM) is a member of ASML Supplier Account team who is responsible for developing and maintaining the technology at ASML suppliers while maintaining the strategic management level relationship to enable an optimal engineering collaboration, and NPI execution.

  

In addition to being the technical interface between supplier, ASML D&E and S&P, the TSM will collaborate on complex technical issues, driving technical process improvements and responsible for developing the capabilities at the supplier to develop and industrialize the applicable ASML products with a well-defined and organized project organization.


TSM can be a member of the Category team where category strategies are developed and supplier selections are done. You’ll play a key role in technical capabilities knowhow within the supply base during the supplier selection process.


As a member of the ASML Supplier Account Team (SAT) you work closely together with the Account Lead (AL) the Logistics Supplier Manager (LSM), Supplier Account Lead (SAL) and Quality Supplier Manager (QSM). TSM contributes to encourage a first-time right and zero repeat technical mindset at suppliers, facilitate accelerated learning (e.g. drive early supplier involvement in the concept design phase of an NPI project), perform process optimization and develop the supplier to a higher maturity level.

**Role and responsibilities**
-----------------------------


The TSM ensures smooth NPI performance on suppliers side and enables ASML D&E to perform and execute ASML Product Generation Process. The TSM works on de-risking the ASML product roadmap by developing technical capabilities in supplier landscape in time, responsible for optimizing the effectiveness and efficiency of executing the supplier’s portfolio. As a TSM you contribute to QLTCS improvements on NPI projects and part quality from technology and quality point of view.


Using your technical knowledge, analytic thinking, professional network and excellent people skills, you are a member of the Supplier Account Team to manage the capability of the supplier according to the agreed Supplier Profile on Technology. The main activities for a TSM are:

* Responsible for the technology section within the Supplier Account Team (SAT)
	+ Driving the technology roadmap in the supplier base
		- Identify the technical capabilities of the supplier
		- Advise to suppliers on strategic level of the technical capabilities
		- Drive improvement projects in technical capabilities
	+ Keep technical supplier capability overview up-to-date
	+ Own the T section of the Supplier Profile Audit in the guidance of lead auditor
	+ Define, monitor and enhance continuous Improvement Plans together with supplier which involve improving the technical capability of supplier as a result of Supplier Profile Audits
	+ Own and drive for T performance
	+ Contribute in defining and executing the overall supply chain strategy
	+ Monitoring the NPI projects to proactively secure operational execution
	+ Participate in new supplier scouting and drive new supplier onboarding
		- Support in preparation of supplier selection proposals
		- Ensure alignment and definition of one Way of Working with the supplier in case of multiple NPI projects
	+ Take part in decision making of new supplier selection.
* Align and mature supplier’s NPI process with ASML PGP process
* Liaison between supplier, D&E and S&P through active participation in SAT by driving technical roadmaps for its suppliers.
	+ Operational guidance and alignment of Supplier Quality Engineers

**Education and experience**
----------------------------


BSc / MSc / PhD degree in Engineering (electrical, mechanical, chemical, optical, industrial), Mathematics or Physics.

* 5-10 years relevant work experience
* Green or Black Belt + Lean Six Sigma experience including tooling (e.g. SPC, FMEA, 8D, MSA) is a plus
* Experience in project & product management in complex high-tech low volume industry
* Experienced in supplier management & related production processes
* Experience in quality improvement & operational excellence in manufacturing environment
* Experience in participating in improvement projects and audits across the supply chain

**Personal skills**
-------------------

* Team player
* Process oriented
* Excellent communication skills
* Pro-active attitude, drive for improvement
* Strong networking and negotiating skills
* Strong analytical skills
* Ability to initiate, influence and steer without formal authority
* Ability to switch between complex matters and high-level conclusions
* Flexible, result driven and committed

**Other information**
---------------------


Within ASML, D&E is responsible for the planning, development, and delivery of integrated solutions that meet business requirements. This responsibility also includes the specification and trade-offs across sectors. Supplier Quality Engineering (SQE), a group within Machine Conditioning (MC) cluster, enables the MC cluster to meet industrialization requirements at suppliers, deliver excellent solutions related to flow and thermal domain towards good product quality.


In today’s complex multi-tier supply chains, this is only possible by creating full transparency in the chains and flexibility at suppliers. The SQE group is involved in over 60 suppliers, on top of that sometimes several tiers deep. For this position international travelling is required, up to 30% depending on the performance of the supplier.


The TSM role is positioned in the Supplier Quality Engineering group in D&E Machine Conditioning. The TSM interfaces with suppliers, design engineers, development project leads, function owners and department managers, supplier network managers, account leads, category manager, customer support, manufacturing.

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
*Do you want to add value to our products by developing and engineering units and components in a multidisciplinary environment? We are always interested to get in touch with talented Mechanical engineers!*  


**Questions about this job?**
Stephanie Vermeulen, Corporate Recruiter
M+31 629693193 or E: stephanie.vermeulen@cpp.canon  


**Mechanical Engineer**
**32-40 hours per week, hybrid in Venlo (NL)**  


**What will be your job like as Mechanical Engineer?**
In our product development projects at R&D you are responsible and focusing on mechanical topics like mediahandling systems, high precision frames, linear and rotational drive systems, printheads, ink fixation units, and more.  

  

Together with the stakeholders (Manufacturing, Service, Purchasing, Quality Assurance) you specify and agree on requirements based on project demands. This is your input together with the designers and architects to come up with technical designs and concepts that meet these objectives, properly balancing time, quality, functionality, and costs (QFTC).  

  

Within the project you collaborate with colleagues from other disciplines. You review your ideas and jointly develop smart creative solutions that meet the overall project objectives. You test and review your model based design(s) by building prototypes to proof the feasibility of the routes you have identified.  


In this role there are plenty of opportunities to further develop yourself, e.g. to lead mechanical engineer, mechanical designer, etc.  


**Responsibilities:**
* Designing mechanical components and units in NX CAD/CAE
* Specify, realize and verify the mechanical design requirements
* Units and parts documentation (Drawings, Instructions, Requirements, etc.)
* Tolerance decompositions in units
* Reviews with vendors
* Perform effectively in a multi-disciplinary team

  


**Furthermore you meet the following criteria:**
* Bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or similar
* Skilled in parametric CAD/CAE systems, Siemens NX
* Eye for detail and excellent problem solving skills
* Knowledge of design principles for precision mechanisms
* Knowledge about manufacturing technologies such as; machining, sheetmetal and plastics
* Team player, hands on, practical, analytic and goal oriented
* Fluent in English, verbal and written. Profound knowledge of Dutch is a plus
* Living nearby Venlo

  


**What can we offer?**
We offer you a job in an open and creative environment within an international organization, where you work with other designers and developers on usability and interaction for products and devices. Your contribution is essential for building an appealing user experience and you work on a variety of projects within product development.  


**And there is more….**
Besides a challenging working environment, scope for personal and professional development you will receive an interesting package of employment conditions:
* a competitive salary, depending on your experience and educational background (€3100,- - €5100,-)
* 38 vacation days
* commuting allowance, standard end-of-year bonus (8,6%), and vacation pay (8%)
* hybrid working for a healthy work-life balance
* a laptop and smartphone
* possibilities to update and grow your knowledge and skills by following trainings, conferences and peer consultation

title: Technical Solution Lead - AI Acceleration Team
description:
**De energietransitie is onmogelijk zonder jou als Technical Solution Lead**


Als Technical Solution Lead bij Alliander ben je cruciaal in het sturen van de technische strategie en visie binnen het AI-domein. Je bent hoofdverantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en in stand houden van een platform voor AI-toepassingen met een team van cloud MLOps engineers.


Je adviseert stakeholders over innovatieve technologieën, zorgt voor de integratie van deze technologieën in onze oplossingsarchitectuur, en bevordert de samenwerking met leveranciers. Door actief ontwikkelingen te volgen en kansen voor optimalisatie te signaleren, draag je bij aan voortdurende verbeteringen en kennisdeling. Als aanspreekpunt voor Product Owner, zowel inhoudelijk als technisch, waarborg je de kwaliteit en toekomstbestendigheid van onze technische oplossingen.


Het energienet van de toekomst maken we voor iedereen, mét iedereen. En als Technical Solution Lead werk jij hieraan mee. Zo ben jij bezig met het:

* Ontwikkelen van functionele en technische ontwerpen die voldoen aan architecturale richtlijnen.
* Zorgen dat de technische implementatie naadloos aansluit op de afnemende teams.
* Bewaken van technische kwaliteit en kennisniveaus van applicaties, en adviseren van Product Owners over technisch lifecycle management.
* Coördineren van probleemoplossing op een gestructureerde manier
* Het vakinhoudelijk coachen van teamleden en stimuleren van innovatie binnen het team.
* Identificeren en implementeren van verbetermogelijkheden in processen en technologieën

**Jij maakt het net completer bij Alliander**


Wist je dat we bij Alliander uit verschillende bedrijven bestaan? Samen met Liander, Qirion, Qterra, Dep, Firan en Entrnce ontwikkelen én beheren we het energienet voor miljoenen inwoners van Nederland. En met de huidige energietransitie is dat hard werken. Dat doen we met de hulp van ruim 8.000 vakmensen. Dankzij deze talenten hebben wij het volste vertrouwen in de energietoekomst van Nederland. Samen met jou maken wij dat mogelijk.


En jij gaat dat doen bij ons bedrijfsonderdeel Alliander.


Dit kan alleen als jij genoeg energie hebt. En de juiste werkomgeving geeft jou dat:

**Het AI Acceleration Team**


Het team waarin je komt te werken, heeft als doel om Alliander te laten versnellen op het gebied van AI. Het is een devops team met Product Owner, Scrummaster, Techlead en MLOps engineers.


Onze afnemers zijn divers: voornamelijk data science teams die interne applicaties ontwikkelen, digitaliseringsteams, analyseteams en enkele business teams. Wij versnellen hen op de volgende thema's:

* Snel en gecontroleerd modellen ontwikkelen op AWS (MLOps voor data science teams) met behulp van Sagemaker en custom images.
* Inzicht en controle bieden door middel van AI-governance tooling, zoals Explainable AI en AI Act.
* Snelle autonome executie door AI-agents met behulp van knowledge bases en vector stores.
* Vergroting van AI-vaardigheden van medewerkers door kennisdeling via Open Space, templates en best practices.
* Operations (beheer, support en continue verbetering van de MLOps-tools en diensten die wij bieden) met security monitoring, geautomatiseerde tests en logging.


Het AI Acceleration team is een platformteam en de engineers trainen dus zelf geen modellen, maar ondersteunen andere teams hierin. Het Team biedt een gestandaardiseerde en geconfigureerde omgeving met tooling voor data analytics, MLOps en access tot data aan. Ook maakt het bouwblokken die de toepassing van LLMs op Alliander data vergemakkelijken zodat de opgeslagen kennis optimaal gebruikt kan worden. Hiermee werken we aan realtime AI-driven decision making.

**Jij maakt het net energieker**


Werken met de nieuwste technieken en innovaties. Dat doe je vanuit je eigen kracht en talent. En dat doe je bij ons. Draag jij daaraan bij met jouw wens om te innoveren?


Met jouw drive excelleer je als Technical Solution Lead. Agile werken en effectief oplossen zijn jouw tweede natuur. Samenwerking en duidelijke communicatie vormen de basis van jouw werkwijze.


Je versterkt ons team met:

* HBO+/WO-werk en denkniveau en bij voorkeur een IT gerelateerde studie gevolgd.
* Minimaal 8 jaar relevante werkervaring
* Technische IT kennis op expertniveau met betrekking tot een aandachtsgebied.
* Ervaring met en kennis van industrialisatie en operationalisering van voorspelmodellen
* Ervaring met het mede opzetten van IT solution architecturen en de implementatie hiervan.
* Vertaalt functionele requirements naar technische requirements
* Ervaring met AWS / CDK / Python / typescript / CI/CD / Docker / Generative AI
* Sparringspartner voor het development team en weet samen met het team breed-gedragen oplossingen te formuleren en kan omgaan met uiteenlopende invalshoeken van developers en weet hun diversiteit in kracht om te zetten

**Voor jou net beter geregeld**


Daarvoor krijg jij op basis van een 38-urige werkweek:

* een salaris van € 5.890,07 tot € 8.414,39 bruto per maand (schaal 11).
* Jaarlijks bovenop je salaris, een individueel keuze budget (IKB) van 18% (fulltime) of 12,8% (parttime) van je bruto jaarsalaris. Dit is inclusief 8% vakantietoeslag. Je kunt dit bedrag uit laten betalen, maar je kunt er bijvoorbeeld ook extra vrije dagen voor kopen. Jij kiest wat bij jou past.
* 24,5 vakantiedagen per jaar, ruim aan te vullen met 35 dagen vanuit je IKB (op fulltime basis).
* een eindejaarsuitkering in december van 6% van je jaarsalaris
* vergoedingen voor studies en trainingen. Alliander vergoedt in de meeste gevallen jouw gehele opleiding.
* een NS-Business Card, zodat je duurzaam kan reizen. Kom je met eigen vervoer? Dan krijg je een kilometertegemoetkoming.


Natuurlijk hebben we nog veel meer! Lees meer over al jouw arbeidsvoorwaarden.

 **Voor jou net wat meer informatie**


Samen maken we het net beter. Voor iedereen, met iedereen. En daar hoor jij bij! Solliciteer via de sollicitatiebutton op deze vacature voor 1 september 2024. Binnen 5 werkdagen krijg je een reactie van ons.

  

We hebben ruimte voor jouw energie! Meer informatie over de vacature? Neem contact op met Sandra Jokhan, Chapter Lead Technical Platforms, via sandra.jokhan@alliander.com. Meer informatie over de selectieprocedure? Neem contact op met Venetia de Wit, Corporate Recruiter via venetia.de.wit@alliander.com


Recruiter


Venetia de Wit
Telefoonnummer:


+31 (6) 15850813

title: Google Cloud Data Engineer
description:
##### **Location: Belgium or The Netherlands**



As a GCP data engineer you are responsible to deliver end-to-end data solutions, enabling your clients to make data-driven decisions based on your solution by collecting, transforming and publishing data.



You enjoy designing, developing, and maintaining robust data pipelines and data architectures on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


**The impact you'll make**
--------------------------


By designing and implementing scalable data pipelines, ensuring efficient data flow and processing. You will optimize data storage, enable real-time analytics, and enhance data security. By leveraging GCP's advanced tools, you facilitate data-driven decision-making, improve operational efficiency, and support business growth through insightful analytics and streamlined data management.



Your expertise drives impactful data solutions.


**Your skills**
---------------


Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines on GCP


Build and manage data warehouses and data lakes using GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Storage, and Dataflow.


Strong proficiency in GCP services such as BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, Cloud Storage, and Cloud Composer.


Expertise in SQL and experience with relational and NoSQL databases.


Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Spark, or Scala.


Experience with ETL tools and frameworks

**Your values**
---------------


Eager to work as a team


Ready to take on a challenge


Curious for new technologies


Fond of data


Cloud-minded

**What's in it for you?**
-------------------------


Work with cutting-edge technology in the field of data engineering


Stay current with the latest developments and best practices on GCP


Continuous (peer)learning

Possibility to participate on a tactical level within our company


Open and informal company culture


Great colleagues

**Why Agiliz**
--------------


We’re a team of about 35 people, all interested in data and analytics. Fun, informal and open communication define us. We’re like a small village where everyone knows everyone and we’re always willing to lend a hand to our neighbour.

  

We don’t limit ourselves to one technology or one business sector, the variety in projects and technology stack in addition to our knowledge sharing culture is one of the reasons why applicants choose for us.

  

Although we believe that our love for team events, food and good vibes might have something to do with it as well.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:

Great colleagues

title: Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague
description:
Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague**Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management:**
  

As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals. To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and deep across asset classes, geographies and solutions.
  

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AWM delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment.
  

**What We Do**
  

Multi-Asset Solutions, "MAS" is an investing group within the Asset Management Division at Goldman Sachs. MAS is responsible for managing customized multi-asset class portfolios and funds, including discretionary mandates for US and international public pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurance companies and providing outsourced CIO services. The team is comprised of professionals with deep and varied investment backgrounds who specialize in designing and implementing customized multi-asset class portfolios.
  

Our Engineering and Strategist teams are responsible for building portfolio management and asset allocation tools to help our portfolio managers and clients make critical investment decisions for multi-billion dollar portfolios. We also build quantitative models that underpin our investment philosophy and process.
  

**Who We Look For**
  

We are looking for quantitative engineers to join our Strats team to help with core initiatives to deliver our next-generation digital experience to internal and external users using open source tools and frameworks. Our goal is to build scalable, extensible tools that have immediate impact on a growing user base and will serve our needs in the long term to outperform our competitors. We are a fun, entrepreneurial team that loves coding, investing, and turning our ideas into reality. We are looking for creative, self-driven developers who want to grow and learn from others in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of software engineering and quantitative backgrounds. You have a track record with JavaScript front and back-end frameworks or Python. You enjoy working with end users to understand the problem at hand and help design the solution, and are excited to learn about investment finance and portfolio management concepts. You will engineer software across all phases of the software development life cycle: partnering with MAS investing professionals to design new features, building those features, creating, and running tests, receiving feedback, and delivering enhancements.
  

**Requirements**
  

* Bachelors, Masters or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics or engineering
* Meaningful experience in, but not limited to, any of the following: Javascript frameworks (React/Angular/Node), MongoDB/NoSQL, SQL, Python
* Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and object oriented programming
* Strong communication skills, ability to work on a fast-paced team and collaborate with stakeholders and end users
* Knowledge of or interest in learning investment finance, portfolio theory and analytics (portfolio optimization, simulation or glidepath)
* 1-2+ years of relevant work experience
  

  

  

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
  

  

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
  

  

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
  

  

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
  

  

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
  

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity
