title: Data Analyst
description:
Bynder goes far beyond managing digital assets. Our digital asset management platform enables teams to conquer the chaos of proliferating content, touchpoints, and relationships in order to thrive.

  



With powerful and intuitive solutions that embrace the way people want to work, and a richly integrated ecosystem, We are the brand ally that unifies and transforms the creation and sharing of assets, inspiring teams, delighting customers, and elevating businesses.

  



Our 500+ employees, known as 'Byndies', together constitute the world's most extensive pool of digital asset management expertise. We enable more than 1.7M users across more than 3,700 organizations, including Spotify, Puma, Five Guys and Icelandair.

  

Founded in 2013, we have eight offices around the globe, including the Netherlands, USA, Spain, UK, Australia and UAE. For more information, visit www.bynder.com.


Bynder's Internal Analytics platform is essential for streamlining our product and business growth by providing best-in-class data and insights to our stakeholders precisely when they need it. We are looking for a skilled **Data Analyst** who will contribute to the technical and analytical efforts of our team, ensuring data-driven decisions and solutions.


### **Responsibilities**


**Data Analysis:** Conduct thorough data analysis to extract meaningful insights, identify trends, and support decision-making processes across the organization.


**Product Analytics**: Conduct in-depth product analytics to identify key trends, user behaviors, and areas for improvement. Collaborate with product teams to drive data-informed decisions and enhance overall product performance.


**Report Generation:** Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like DBT, Snowflake, and ThoughtSpot to provide stakeholders with actionable insights.


**Collaboration:** Work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value. Collaborate with other teams in Bynder's Data Group to ensure data consistency and accuracy.


**Technical Contribution:** Utilize your technical skills to manage and manipulate large datasets, ensuring data quality and integrity. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and tools to continuously improve our data practices.


### **Qualifications**


**Experience**: Minimum of 3 years in data analytics, with hands-on experience in analyzing and interpreting complex data sets.


**Technical Skills**: Proficiency in SQL and Python is essential. Experience in DBT, data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake) or machine learning is a plus.


**Communication**: Strong communication skills to effectively convey insights and collaborate with team members and stakeholders.


**Collaboration:** Demonstrated ability to work with internal stakeholders and engineers to deliver exceptional outputs.



Join us to leverage your analytical expertise to drive Bynder's growth through data and analytics. If you have a passion for data and an aptitude for technical problem-solving, we want to hear from you!

  


### **Why you'll love Bynder!**



At Bynder, innovation is in our DNA. We've worked hard to build an environment that promotes creative thinking and self-initiative within a culture of fun. It's common to find colleagues hanging out after work - if you believe in "be nice, work hard, have fun", you'll have an office full of friends.


### **What we have:**


* Challenging and inspiring work environment
* Flat hierarchy where your voice will be truly heard
* Opportunity to initiate your own projects
* An experienced team is ready to welcome you anytime
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Competitive monthly compensation
* Apple gear
* Daily lunch
* Drinks at the Bynder Bar :-)
* Amazing office in the heart of Amsterdam

### **Our Commitment:**



Bynder Love is the principle that guides the way we grow our teams, support our employees, and celebrate our differences. At Bynder we strive to create a culture that embraces every Byndie because differences in background, experience, and perspective make Bynder even better. At Bynder a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees, whatever their ethnicity, color, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or physical and mental ability are valued and respected. Our commitment is for all Byndies to have the freedom to be their true authentic selves.



Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder's commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.



#LI-Hybrid

title: Bridge Developer intern
description:
Eindhoven, Netherlands
Category
 Research & Development
Posted Date
 07/03/2024
Job Id
 341422
  
Want to work on the world’s leading smart home lighting system? This role is in IoT development team within Hue Connected R&D in The Netherlands, and you will be working alongside other software engineers on one of the world’s largest commercial IoT systems. The team is continuously improving the IoT functionality by a/o improving the performance and availability of the services, so a customer-first mentality must be in your DNA.

  

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive while working in a fast-paced company. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career while transforming our industry.

  

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new ground in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

  

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

**What you'll do**
------------------

  

The Hue bridge is the heart of the Philips Hue ecosystem. It connects the mobile apps to our lights, it controls all the automations within your setup, and it connects to the cloud for things like out of home control and voice control.

  

With this assignment, you will work along with the IoT team within the Business Line Hue Connected in Eindhoven to look at opportunities to move to a different embedded Linux build system.

**Your qualifications**
-----------------------

* You are finalizing a Bachelor degree in the field of Computer Science / Software Engineering.
* Available for minimally 6-8 months (> 32 hrs/week) and able to start your internship in September - October 2024.
* Proactive and enthusiastic to communicate with senior stakeholders.
* A self-starter who has an affinity with software technology.
* You are proud of what you do, have a deep passion to do things right, and are ready to learn on the job.
* You have experience with Linux, know how to get it bootstrapped on hardware..
* You have experience with C, C++, Rust, Python, Bash; some knowledge of C# is considered a great bonus.
* You understand the agile development process, and you know how to use Git-based tools.
**What you’ll get in return…**
------------------------------

* Internship allowance: the exact amount depends on your situation (also towards rented accommodation or public transportation).
* Paid leave based on 1 day per month.
* Extensive set of tools to drive your career, such as a personalized learning platform.
* Opportunity to purchase products at reduced prices.
* Opportunity to be part of a team managing one of the world’s largest fleets of IoT connected products.
  

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

  

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

**What we promise…**
--------------------

  

We’re committed to the continuous development of our employees, using our learning to shape the future of light and create a sustainable future. Join the undisputed leader in the lighting industry and be part of our diverse global team.

  

Notes

* EU/EER students: In order to be considered for this internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of this may be requested at any time.
* Non-EU students in Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and your university needs to sign the Nuffic Agreement. The internship needs to be a compulsory part of your studies (receive ECTS in turn). In case of non-compulsory internship, you need to have a letter from the university in which it states that your internship contributes to your personal development, what your learning goals are and what tasks you will undertake during your internship. The letter has to be signed and stamped by your university.
* Non-EU students in non-Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and the internship should be a compulsory part of your studies. Also, you need to be able to get the official approval of your university for this internship (Nuffic agreement).

Please apply only if you can meet the aforementioned requirements.

title: Communication Officer – Quantum Internet
description:
Communication Officer – Quantum Internet
 Apply Now
Job description


Are you proactive, passionate and ready for a new meaningful challenge? Do you already have experience as a communication advisor and outreach manager and a passion or background in Science? This role is for you!



In this unique role, you will be working at QuTech, dedicating all your efforts to QIA, the Quantum Internet Alliance. As a Communication officer, you will have the opportunity to become an integral part of QIA, a collaboration involving more than 40 industrial and academic organizations across Europe.



QIA's mission is to build a global Quantum Internet by developing a full-stack prototype network that validates all key subsystems. Additionally, QIA aims to foster an innovative European Quantum Internet ecosystem, capable of scaling all sub-systems to achieve world-leading European technology.



Find out more about QIA at https://quantuminternetalliance.org/



As our Communication officer your responsibilities will be to raise awareness about the Quantum Internet Alliance (QIA) and its mission and execute various activities such as:



Your responsibilities will include:


* Engaging with the communication offices of QIA partners to align, support, and monitor the writing and publication of press releases and news articles, and promoting them through QIA channels.
* Preparing QIA’s monthly newsletter.
* Providing communication and outreach support for QIA activities such as QIA Hackathons, Use Case Challenges, the QIA Technology Forum…
* Creating rich media outreach materials for print and online use.
* Managing QIA’s social media channels (LinkedIn and Twitter) and online collaboration platforms (Teams and Slack), including but not limited to engaging with relevant stakeholders, answering queries and monitoring analytics.
* Organizing QIA’s participation in industry events, and providing support in QIA-organized events.
* Managing the QIA website, including content creation by writing and publishing news updates and other content, website maintenance, and SEO optimization using best practices and analyzing website metrics.
* Managing QIA’s social media presence by developing content strategies, creating relevant campaigns and engaging posts, increasing engagement with QIA results, and analyzing social media performance to adjust strategies as needed.


Requirements


We are looking for a Communication officer who is hands on, creative with 3 years of experience at least in communication, outreach and community building, preferably in a technical environment.



Furthermore you have:


* HBO or Bachelors’ Degree
* Knowledge of CMS and social media marketing & analytics tools.
* Ability to work in a large consortium of partners across several European countries.
* Interest in quantum technology.


**Dutch citizenship or a European working permit is required to apply. For this role ideally we would like someone to be able to start in September or latest October.**


Conditions of employment


This is a replacement for a maternity cover, we will offer you a 10th month contract which can be extended if needed. The UFO profile is Communication officer 1 with a full-time salary based on VSNU-CAO Scale 9 (3377 Euros to 4640 Euros).



Additionally, you will also receive:


* A choice of working contract from 24 h to 32 h per week.
* 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
* An excellent pension scheme via the ABP.
* The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year.
* Discount on health insurance.
* Flexible working week.
* Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget.
* Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program.


TU Delft


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


QuTech


QuTech is a mission-driven research institute run jointly by Delft University of Technology (TU Delft) and the Netherlands Organization for Applied Scientific Research (TNO). Together, we work on a radically new technology with world-changing potential, developing scalable prototypes of a quantum computer and an intrinsically safe quantum internet.



We are creating the quantum future, and we believe that quantum technology will be a game changer in many social and economic sectors – including health, agriculture, climate and safety. To achieve our ambitious goals, we bring together scientists, engineers and industry in an inspiring environment, with plenty of space for ambition, entrepreneurship and innovation. Our research and engineering activities are conducted in three divisions: Quantum Computing, Quantum Internet and Qubit Research. 220 FTE and over 300 curious people work in our divisions and support teams, and we actively welcome new colleagues who share our vision and enthusiasm.



Have a look at our video and get a glimpse of QuTech.


Application procedure


For information about this position, you can contact Vlora Rexhepi- van der Pol, QIA Innovation Manager at V.Rexhepi-vanderPol@tudelft.nl



For questions concerning the procedure please contact Audrey Monje, Senior Recruiter at QuTech at A.monje@tudelft.nl



If you are interested in this position, please apply via the application button on this page before the 28th July 2024.



The applications submitted will be reviewed on a rolling basis and the position maybe closed for application if a suitable candidate is found.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **QuTech**

JOB TYPE### **Marketing and communications**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **not applicable**

HOURS PER WEEK### **24h to 32h**

SALARY### **€ 3.377,00 - € 4.640,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **Secondary Vocational higher level +**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05525**


Apply Now

title: Medior Data Engineer
CISO Security Data Engineer
description:
**Tech & IT*** **Data & Analytics**
* **Zoetermeer**
* **Senior**
* **HBO**
**Highlights**
--------------


Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 5043,- en € 8255,- afhankelijk van inschaling & werkervaring
* Een variabele-bonusregeling
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris
  

#ee4e7b30-a290-4007-a6e6-d7d0f07ab24f
***Als CISO Security Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van de gehele dataketen onderliggend aan de Security Watchtower. Je draagt zorg voor het analyseren, extraheren, transformeren en gestructureerd opslaan van data uit verschillende systemen welke als basis dienen voor Security Reporting over de KPN-securityprocessen en voor analytische doeleinden. We maken hiervoor maximaal gebruik van bestaande datalakes en infrastructuur***

**Jouw rol als CISO Security Data Engineer**
--------------------------------------------


Als CISO Security Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van de gehele dataketen onderliggend aan de Security Watchtower. Je draagt zorg voor het analyseren, extraheren, transformeren en gestructureerd opslaan van data uit verschillende systemen welke als basis dienen voor Security Reporting over de KPN-securityprocessen en voor analytische doeleinden. We maken hiervoor maximaal gebruik van bestaande datalakes en infrastructuur
**Dit is je team**
------------------


KPN CISO is een onderdeel van KPN Technology & Digital Office (TDO) en bestaat uit vier teams, verspreid over twee locaties (Amsterdam en Hilversum). In de CISO-afdeling werken ongeveer 70 collega’s, aangevuld met student-onderzoekers en (interne) stagiaires. Verschillende collega’s hebben een internationale achtergrond. Daarmee is, naast Nederlands, Engels de voertaal. Deze functie valt binnen het CISO Monitoring & Reporting team.


Het CISO Monitoring & Reporting team heeft een tweedelijns risicobeheersingsfunctie en is verantwoordelijk voor het adviseren en uitdagen van het management. De activiteiten van dit team zijn gericht op het beantwoorden van één belangrijke vraag: Hoe veilig is KPN op het gebied van cybersecurity? Om hier antwoord op te kunnen geven richt het team zich op twee assen. Namelijk Compliance en Performance. Performance richt zich op het kwantitatief meten en analyseren van de effectiviteit van securityprocessen. Compliance richt zich op het evalueren van security risico’s en maatregelen in het kader van wet, regelgeving en (interne) normenkaders. Door het monitoren en rapporteren vanuit deze twee invalshoeken creëren we inzicht en awareness binnen de organisatie vanaf de werkvloer tot aan het hoogste managementniveau.
**Wat breng**
**jij ons?**
--------------------------


Voor deze vacature van wordt het volgende van je verwacht:

* Je hebt wo werk- en denkniveau en bij voorkeur een opleiding in een passende richting;
* Je bent communicatief vaardig en beheerst naast de Nederlandse ook de Engelse taal;
* Je bent goed in het werken in (virtuele) teams en je bent in staat om richting te geven en jouw omgeving mee te nemen.
* Daarbij ben je in staat om in een dynamische omgeving gestructureerd te werken;
* Je hebt kennis en ervaring op het gebied van: ETL, database programmering, data modellering en monitoring;
* Specifiek: Microsoft MSSQL, SQL, Apache Hop / Pentaho, GIT, scripting (bijvoorbeeld met Python).
* Je bent leergierig en bereid om security specifieke cursussen te volgen;
* Kennis en ervaring van cloud infrastructuur van Azure en/ of AWS is een pré.


**Wat krijg je**
**van ons?**
-----------------------------


Natuurlijk hebben we als werkgever jou ook veel te bieden. Dit krijg je van ons:

* Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 5043,- en € 8255,- afhankelijk van inschaling & werkervaring
* Een 37-urige werkweek
* Mogelijkheid tot keuzetijd tot 40 uur per week, 8,5% brutosalaris erbij
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris (inclusief 8% vakantiegeld)
* Een variabele-bonusregeling behorende bij schaal 12
* Jaarlijks een individuele en collectieve verhoging vanuit KPN CAO
* Een mobiele telefoon en laptop
* Goede doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden en een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget van € 1500,-/€ 2500,-. Sterker nog, we verwachten van jou dat jij je blijft ontwikkelen!
* Thuiswerkshop om je werkplek thuis optimaal in te kunnen richten
* 50% korting op KPN-producten en -diensten, zoals KPN-internet
* Een reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer van € 0,23 per kilometer of volledige vergoeding 2e klas OV, € 10,- per maand internet en € 2,15 per dag thuiswerkvergoeding.
* Een reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer: zoals onze fietsvergoeding van € 0,40 per kilometer, of € 0,23 per kilometer, of volledige vergoeding 2e klas OV. Daarnaast krijg je € 10,- per maand internetvergoeding en een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,15 per dag
* Uitstekende pensioenvoorwaarden: een totale inleg van 23% van je pensioengevende salaris waarvan KPN 16% inlegt en jij 7%


Ons geloof in technologie is groot. Dit wordt nóg krachtiger samen met menselijk contact, daarom ontmoeten we je graag!


Voor verdere vragen of meer informatie, aarzel niet om contact op te nemen met onze recruiter, Keesjan Bongaertz. Je kunt hem bereiken via e-mail: keesjan.j.bongaertz@kpn.com.

  


**Wat gebeurt er**
**na je sollicitatie?**
------------------------------------------


**01**
**Telefonisch contact**
-----------------------


Onze recruiters leren je graag beter kennen en nemen daarom telefonisch contact met je op!
**02**
**Gesprekken**
--------------


Zijn we van beide kanten enthousiast? Dan plannen we een eerste, tweede en eventueel een derde gesprek en/of assesment in.
**03**
**Wij doen jou een aanbod**
---------------------------


Als alle gesprekken goed zijn gegaan, doen we je een aanbod. Een screening kan onderdeel zijn van dit proces.
**04**
**Welkom in het team**
----------------------


Als je blij bent met het aanbod en je het contract hebt getekend, begint jouw onboarding. Welkom bij KPN!

title: Oracle Security Expert
description:
**Tech & IT*** **Engineering**
* **Rotterdam**
* **Senior**
* **HBO**
**Highlights**
--------------


Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 3526,- en € 5519,- afhankelijk van inschaling & werkervaring
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris
* Een 37-urige werkweek
  

#5aae5206-a1d0-479c-a33f-fd60f4406950
***Ben jij klaar om jouw expertise in Oracle Cloud Applications naar een hoger niveau te tillen? Bij Finance Insights & Analytics krijg je de kans om een belangrijke rol te spelen in het beheer en de verbetering van ons Oracle Security Framework. Werk samen met top professionals, ontwikkel je vaardigheden verder, en draag bij aan de toekomst van ons Oracle Reporting team. Kies voor een dynamische werkomgeving met veel mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke groei en kennisuitwisseling.***

**Jouw rol als Oracle Security Expert**
---------------------------------------


In deze rol als Oracle Security Expert ben jij de spil in het waarborgen van het Security Framework voor onze Oracle Cloud Applicatie. Hieronder vallen HCM/ERP/SCM, de Enterprise Performance Applications (EPM) en Fusion Data Intelligence (FDI). Je krijgt de kans om je vaardigheden te benutten en verder te ontwikkelen, terwijl je samenwerkt met diverse teams. Je takenpakket is gevarieerd en uitdagend, waarbij je een directe impact hebt op onze bedrijfscontinuïteit en security-standaarden. Je taken omvatten onder andere:

* Opzetten en beheren van het Security Framework vanuit het functionele domein, inclusief het configureren van functionele rollen en rechten en het gedegen documenteren hiervan.
* Fungeren als sparringpartner met IT en andere ketenpartners om het Security Framework te optimaliseren.
* Beheren van het incidentenmanagementproces in samenwerking met IT: incidenten analyseren, opvolging verzorgen, en coördineren van oplossingen met andere oplosgroepen.
* Uitvoeren van periodieke assessments voor security- en risicomanagement in samenwerking met IT, en het adviseren van product owners en andere stakeholders binnen het Security Framework
* Implementeren van continuous improvement-activiteiten, waaronder de vereenvoudiging van het Security Framework.


**Dit is je team**
------------------


Binnen de afdeling Finance Insights & Analytics (FIA) werk je samen met ongeveer 40 professionals, waaronder developers, data scientists, data engineers, consultants, scrum masters en product owners. Als onderdeel van het Oracle Reporting Centre of Excellence (CoE) werk je in een Scrum-team bestaande uit een product owner, een scrummaster, vijf developers en twee consultants. Je werkt intensief samen met collega's uit IT, HR, GBS, Risk Management en Finance.  

**Wat breng**
**jij ons?**
--------------------------


Voor de rol van Oracle Security Expert bij KPN is het belangrijk dat je werk proactief oppakt en zelfstandig taken initieert. Je werkt goed in teamverband en beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden. Samen met je collega's ontwikkel je nieuwe inzichten op een Agile manier. Jouw expertise draagt bij aan de innovatie en transformatie van deze functie. Je hebt kennis van de volgende tools en vaardigheden:.

* Je hebt een HBO of WO-diploma
* 6 jaar relevante werkervaring, inclusief ervaring met DevOps, Scrum en Agile
* Kennis van Oracle SaaS rollen en data access inclusief die van het Fusion Data Intelligence Platform
* Kennis van risk management & functiescheiding, Identity & Access Management (IAM) applicatie
* Bekendheid met Advanced Access Control (AAC) binnen Oracle is een pluspunt
* Kennis van processen binnen het Finance en HR-domein, evenals ondersteunende Oracle Cloud Application-modules, wordt gewaardeerd.


Tik je niet alle bullets aan? We nodigen je alsnog van harte uit om te reageren.
**Wat krijg je**
**van ons?**
-----------------------------


Natuurlijk hebben we als werkgever jou ook veel te bieden. Dit krijg je van ons:

* Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 4300,- en maximaal €6569 ,- afhankelijk van je werkervaring, op basis van 37 uur
* Keuzetijd tot en met 40 uur per week mogelijk, waardoor je er maximaal 8,5% brutosalaris bij krijgt
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris (inclusief 8% vakantiegeld)
* Een variabele-bonusregeling van 9% behorende bij schaal 11
* Jaarlijks een individuele en collectieve verhoging conform onze CAO
* Goede doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden en een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget van € 1500,-. Sterker nog, we verwachten van jou dat jij je blijft ontwikkelen!
* Een goede werk-privé balans (zoals 2 dagen kantoor, 3 dagen thuis, transitieverlof, feestdagwissel naar een feestdag van jouw religieuze of culturele voorkeur)
* Thuiswerkshop om je werkplek thuis optimaal in te kunnen richten, uiteraard met een mobiele telefoon & laptop
* 50% korting op KPN-producten en -diensten, zoals KPN-internet
* Een reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer: zoals onze fietsvergoeding van € 0,40 per kilometer, of € 0,23 per kilometer, of volledige vergoeding 2e klas OV. Daarnaast krijg je € 10,- per maand internetvergoeding en een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,15 per dag

title: Senior Data Architect Azure
description:
Who we are


You enjoy creating and innovating. You never stop striving for better. You take responsibility and you get results. You love being part of a team. Above all, you want your work to matter: Welcome to our world! At Sonova we create sense by bringing sound to life. Our innovative hearing care solutions help millions of people enjoy life’s unforgettable moments.


We offer exceptional career opportunities through market-leading brands from consumer to medical, products and services that keep pushing hearing care forward, and a culture where you can quickly belong and perform at your best.


If you want the freedom to explore, opportunities to grow, and make positive change on people lives through your work, this is the place for you.


Join Sonova. Create sense.


Rotterdam, Netherlands
Senior Data Architect Azure


154177
We are seeking a dynamic Senior Data Architect to join our team, specializing in Azure-based solutions. In this pivotal role, you will manage all data architect activities from concept to delivery, working closely with the data platform lead. You will collaborate with peers to ensure the timely completion of projects, aligning with data project requirements. As a crucial intermediary between business intelligence and data science, you have a strong background in designing, implementing, and managing large-scale data solutions on Azure, with a focus on leveraging Databricks for data processing, analytics, and machine learning.  


*This position is available for candidates in either Rotterdam, Netherlands, or Warsaw, Poland.*  

  

**Your tasks**  


* Develop data architecture specifications based on requirements provided by business stakeholders
* Design, implement, and oversee data architectures using Azure Databricks to support large-scale data processing, analytics, and machine learning workloads
* Architect, extract, and transform information from MS D365 systems and different ERP solutions
* Prepare data structures and assist in implementation on Azure using Microsoft technologies
* Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver scalable solutions
* Work independently on projects, analyzing complex business processes and translating them into data sources
* Contribute to global Business Intelligence and Analytics architecture decisions and provide consulting services to business units
* Integrate new solutions into existing data governance and authorization frameworks, ensuring compliance with policies and standards

  


**Your profile**  


* University degree in IT, Mathematics, Science, Engineering, or a related discipline
* At least 3-5 years’ experience in implementations as Microsoft Azure Solution Architecture
* Extensive experience in project and data management
* Experience in mapping and building data system landscapes and data marketing processes
* Experience in managing data interfaces as part of a full data pipeline (from sourcing to deployment)
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken

  

  

**Our offer**  


We can offer you a new challenge, with interesting tasks and much more – including an open corporate culture, flat hierarchies, support for further training and development, opportunities to take on responsibility, an excellent range of foods, sports and cultural facilities, attractive employment conditions, and flexible working time models. Employment level: 80 – 100%.  


Marcel Huber, Senior Manager Recruitment Delivery CH & PL, is looking forward to receiving your complete application via our online job application platform.  


For this vacancy only direct applications will be considered.
Sonova is an equal opportunity employer.


We team up. We grow talent. We collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds to win with the best team in the market place. We guarantee every person equal treatment in regard to employment and opportunity for employment, regardless of a candidate’s ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation or marital status, gender, genetic identity, age, disability or any other legally protected status.

Data DevOps Engineer


154179

* Load data from various sources in different formats into the data lake
* Manage resource groups and access rights
* Monitor performance and availability of data endpoints to meet uptime requirements

title: DevOps Data Engineer
description:
**Tech & IT*** **Data & Analytics**
* **Amersfoort**
* **Medior**
* **HBO**
**Highlights**
--------------


Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 3526,- en € 5519,- afhankelijk van inschaling & werkervaring
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris
* Een 37-urige werkweek
  

#e28564a6-76ee-4582-b3b0-626702e127aa
***Ben jij klaar om een sleutelrol te spelen in de digitale transformatie van KPN? Als DevOps Data Engineer bij KPN krijg je de kans om te werken met de nieuwste technologieën in een innovatieve omgeving. Je krijgt veel vrijheid voor je eigen ideeën en de kans om een directe impact te hebben op onze data-gedreven beslissingen en automatisering. Kies voor deze rol en maak impact met jouw expertise in Data Services.***

**Jouw rol als DevOps Data Engineer**
-------------------------------------


In deze rol werk je aan de volledige data-infrastructuur, van aanvoer en verwerking tot inzicht en monitoring. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van tooling, het vullen ervan met data en het beschikbaar stellen van inzichten aan onze interne en externe klanten. Je werkt in een multidisciplinair scrum-team binnen de unit B2BS, waarbij je zorgt voor de continuïteit en kwaliteit van onze data-voorziening. Je taken omvatten onder andere:

* Het platform correct configureren en technisch beschikbaar houden
* Verantwoordelijkheid voor connectiviteit en datastromen van en naar het platform
* Koppelen van databronnen en zorgen voor de juiste datalevering
* Uitvoeren van ontwikkelingswerkzaamheden, upgrades en migraties van tools
* nemen aan waakdiensten (1x per 2 maanden)
* Innovaties volgen en voorstellen doen om de toolset te vernieuwen


**Dit is je team**
------------------


Je werkt binnen het Data Services team van de afdeling Platforms, bestaande uit 13 gedreven collega's verdeeld over een front-end en back-end team. Samen zijn jullie verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van hoogwaardige tooling en data-automatisering. Het team kenmerkt zich door een positieve, kritische houding en een flinke dosis humor, wat bijdraagt aan een prettige werksfeer en succesvolle samenwerking.  

**Wat breng**
**jij ons?**
--------------------------


Voor deze functie zoeken we iemand met een sterke combinatie van technische kennis en soft skills. Je bent leergierig, ambitieus en hebt een proactieve houding. Met jouw sterke communicatievaardigheden weet je zowel binnen als buiten het team effectief te overleggen en samen te werken. Om dit succesvol te kunnen doen heb je in ieder geval:

* HBO werk- en denkniveau met minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in een Agile omgeving
* Uitgebereide ervaring met data analytics, scripting/programmering (Python, PHP), en kennis van Linux, Windows, Puppet, GitHub, Azure, Azure DevOps, Kubernetes en CI/CD
* Ervaring met datalakes, big data, streaming (Kafka), non-streaming en security by design
* Hands-on ervaring met automatiseringstrajecten en een drive voor continue verbetering
* Een "can-do" mentaliteit, acteren volgens de Agile en LEAN principes


Tik je niet alle bullets aan? We nodigen je alsnog van harte uit om te reageren.
**Wat krijg je**
**van ons?**
-----------------------------


Natuurlijk hebben we als werkgever jou ook veel te bieden. Dit krijg je van ons:

* Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 4300,- en maximaal €6500 ,- afhankelijk van je werkervaring, op basis van 37 uur
* Keuzetijd tot en met 40 uur per week mogelijk, waardoor je er maximaal 8,5% brutosalaris bij krijgt
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris (inclusief 8% vakantiegeld)
* Een variabele-bonusregeling van 7% behorende bij schaal 11
* Jaarlijks een individuele en collectieve verhoging conform onze CAO
* Goede doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden en een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget van € 1500,-. Sterker nog, we verwachten van jou dat jij je blijft ontwikkelen!
* Een goede werk-privé balans (zoals 2 dagen kantoor, 3 dagen thuis, transitieverlof, feestdagwissel naar een feestdag van jouw religieuze of culturele voorkeur)
* Thuiswerkshop om je werkplek thuis optimaal in te kunnen richten, uiteraard met een mobiele telefoon & laptop
* 50% korting op KPN-producten en -diensten, zoals KPN-internet
* Een reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer: zoals onze fietsvergoeding van € 0,40 per kilometer, of € 0,23 per kilometer, of volledige vergoeding 2e klas OV. Daarnaast krijg je € 10,- per maand internetvergoeding en een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,15 per dag
* Uitstekende pensioenvoorwaarden: een totale inleg van 23% van je pensioengevende salaris waarvan KPN 16% inlegt en jij 7%


Ons geloof in technologie is groot. Dit wordt nóg krachtiger samen met menselijk contact, daarom ontmoeten we je graag!


Bij KPN hebben we recruitmenttalent dat slim samenwerkt en zo wint. Daarom wordt acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature niet gewaardeerd.


Wil je meer weten? Neem contact op met onze recruiter sabina via sabina.bharati@kpn.com
**Wat gebeurt er**
**na je sollicitatie?**
------------------------------------------


**01**
**Telefonisch contact**
-----------------------


Onze recruiters leren je graag beter kennen en nemen daarom telefonisch contact met je op!
**02**
**Gesprekken**
--------------


Zijn we van beide kanten enthousiast? Dan plannen we een eerste, tweede en eventueel een derde gesprek en/of assesment in.
**03**
**Wij doen jou een aanbod**
---------------------------


Als alle gesprekken goed zijn gegaan, doen we je een aanbod. Een screening kan onderdeel zijn van dit proces.
**04**
**Welkom in het team**
----------------------


Als je blij bent met het aanbod en je het contract hebt getekend, begint jouw onboarding. Welkom bij KPN!
**Zie je een groene toekomst al voor je? Reageer!**
---------------------------------------------------


Voornaam


Achternaam


Telefoonnummer


E-mailadres


CV Uploaden


Motivatie Uploaden


I accept the terms & conditions: SmartRecruiters, KPN.


Verstuur sollicitatie

title: Data Engineer
Data Engineer (Junior, Mid, Senior)
description:
Do you get excited when hearing about trademarks and brand protection news? YES?! So do we! At Corsearch, there’s no pushing trademark solutions and brand protection from our thoughts. We’re thinking about coined trademarks in the car, a detailed design search over lunch, counterfeits while sitting with the in-laws, and anti-piracy while working out


We are a mission-led company, driven by a passion for making the world better and safer for our brand customers and their consumers. It’s what we do. And people come to Corsearch to be challenged, developed, supported, and valued


**The Role**


Technology at Corsearch currently consists of Engineering and Data Science functions, with nearly 200 people globally, aligned to Trademark Solutions or Online Brand Protection Business Units.


Trademark Solutions acquires data from 200 jurisdictions globally by means of data feeds, web crawling and publications/gazettes. The master data system ingests, enriches and stores data in order to support a complex ecosystem of platforms which underpin Corsearch’s managed search, screening & watch services.


The current master data system (“DMS”) is based on C#, MS SQL and MySQL. Corsearch is looking to recruit a new team to build out & transition to a replacement platform using managed services in the cloud.


The ideal candidate will have had prior experience with traditional database-driven software in .Net and Microsoft SQL and more recent experience with modern cloud Data Warehouse, Data Lake and ETL platforms.


We currently have roles available for:

* Junior
* Mid Level
* Senior


**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Assist in establishing the vision and **delivering a future** **master data, ingestion & analytics platform** for Trademark Solutions, based on scalable cloud technologies
* **Transition data flows** and dependencies from the legacy DMS to the new cloud data platform in order to enable DMS to be decomissioned
* **Integrate machine learning** into the data pipelines in order to enrich the data
* **Increase levels of automation**
* Establish **monitoring and measurement** of data quality & ingestion processes
* Ensure a **well-designed data model** where changes are managed and coordinated across the system
* Establish Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment pipelines, Infrastructure as code and Zero-downtime release processes
* Deliver quality code and create full documentation, including flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code, for all developed solutions

**Essential**

* Technical Skills
	+ Cloud Data Lakes & Warehouses, such as Databricks, Redshift or Snowflake
	+ SQL programming, including cloud/distributed SQL engines
	+ Relational databases, such as SQL Server, MySQL or Oracle
	+ Apache Spark, or similar
	+ Cloud ETL such as dbt, Matillion, talend
	+ Cloud Hosting with AWS
	+ Python
	+ Columnar data stores
	+ ORM
	+ Schema definitions, e.g. Avro
	+ Non-relational databases such as Redis or MongoDB
	+ Source Control and CI/CD systems, such as Git
* Engineering Practices, such as TDD and continuous integration
* Jira and Confluence
* Technical documentation, such as coding styles, branching strategies and functional specifications
* Automated enforcement of policies (e.g. linting, static analysis, stylecop)
* Agile development practices and continuous improvement
* Adopter of Open Source and awareness of intellectual property concerns
* Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science or similar field

 **Beneficial Skills & Experience:**


* Elasticsearch or Solr
* Familiarity with web crawling, OCR and PDF extraction
* Familiarity with Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing
* Data visualisation tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI


Corsearch is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and does not tolerate discrimination of any kind. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported. We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of race, nationality, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. Together, we are working proactively to build a workplace where everyone can belong and be at their best selves. Together, we make an Impact.

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Product
description:
Be part of something revolutionary
At o9 Solutions, our mission is clear: be the Most Valuable Platform (MVP) for enterprises. With our AI-driven platform — the o9 Digital Brain — we integrate global enterprises’ siloed planning capabilities, helping them capture millions and, in some cases, billions of dollars in value leakage. But our impact doesn’t stop there. Businesses that plan better and faster also reduce waste, which drives better outcomes for the planet, too.  

We're on the lookout for the brightest, most committed individuals to join us on our mission. Along the journey, we’ll provide you with a nurturing environment where you can be part of something truly extraordinary and make a real difference for companies and the planet.  

About the role...
The ML Engineer plays a pivotal role in our organization, creating and maintaining advanced algorithmic libraries that our entire team relies on, including Data Scientists. Our ideal candidate is a highly experienced developer with a strong foundation in Data Science. As a ML Engineer, you will be responsible for developing algorithms that are robust, scalable, and maintainable. Algorithms that can handle immense volumes of data.
What you’ll do for us* Developing advanced models for time-series forecasting and anomaly detection specifically tailored for the CPG and Retail Industry.
* Ensure the scalability of our solutions and continuously optimize the performance of existing algorithms.
* Assure seamless integration of our libraries with the o9 Platform.
* Support Data Scientists using our algorithms.
* Keep us up-to-date with the latest academic research in the field.


Essential Qualifications & Skills
Experience:* 3+ years of experience in the field of Data Science and Machine Learning
* Experience with time series forecasting at scale in a retail environment is a big plus.
* Experience with open source contributions is a plus.


Education:* Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or related field or
* Masters Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Business Analytics, Operations, or related field


Skills:
Algorithms and Domain Knowledge:* Deep knowledge of fundamentals, and the state-of-the art, in relevant areas of ML, particularly time-series forecasting.
* Understanding of Supply Chain Concepts will be preferable


Language, Tools and Best Practices:* Strong Python programming skills and experience with at least one “lower level” language C/C++ or C#.
* Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full software development lifecycle, including coding standards, code reviews, and source control management.
* Knowledge of parallelizing frameworks such as Multiprocessing, Spark, Ray, etc and optimizing code for such frameworks is preferred.
* Experience working with Hadoop and Hive would be preferable.


Characteristics* Strong presentation and communications skills. You thrive in a fast paced, challenging environment, where there is much white space and problem solving is at the heart of what drives your analysis.
* We really value team spirit: Transparency and frequent communication is key. At o9, this is not limited by hierarchy, distance, or function
* Openness to learn from industry experts as well as willingness to mentor junior engineers.


What we’ll do for you* Competitive salary.
* Tech tools: Complementary Mac or PC laptop.
* Enjoy yourself: Unlimited paid time off.
* Get social: When we work from home, we play from home with fun after-work activities like Social Fridays. If you’re in the office, feel free to join these events in person.
* Flat organization: With a very strong entrepreneurial culture (and no corporate politics).
* Support network: Work with a team you can learn from and every day.
* Diversity: We pride ourselves on our international working environment.


Employee Testimonial*''What I like most about o9 is that I get to work with some of the smartest people in the industry. Every day is a new opportunity to learn and grow. At the same time everyone is friendly, helpful and fun to be around!''*
How the process works* Apply by clicking the apply button.
* You’ll be contacted by our recruiter, who’ll fill you in on all things o9, give you some background about the role and get to know you. They’ll contact you either via video call or phone call - whatever you prefer.
* During the interview phase, you will meet with the Hiring Manager for 45 minutes. The recruiter will contact you after the interview to let you know if we’d like to progress your application.
* Your application has progressed! Meet with a new panel for a final round of interviews for 30 minutes each.
* Our recruiter will let you know if you’re the successful candidate. Good luck!


More about us…  

With the latest increase in our valuation from $2.7B to $3.7B despite challenging global macroeconomic conditions, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the world today. Our mission is to digitally transform planning and decision-making for the enterprise and the planet. Our culture is high-energy and drives us to aim 10x in everything we do.  

Our platform, the o9 Digital Brain, is the premier AI-powered, cloud-native platform driving the digital transformations of major global enterprises including Google, Walmart, ABInBev, Starbucks and many others.
Our headquarters are located in Dallas, with offices in Amsterdam, Paris, London, Barcelona, Madrid, Sao Paolo, Bengaluru, Tokyo, Seoul, Milan, Stockholm, Sydney, Shanghai, Singapore Munich, Toronto.*o9 is an equal opportunity employer and seeks applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Senior Data Analytics Engineer
description:
**Finaps is an exciting and enjoyable place to work, where we are proud of our achievements and the solutions we create.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


At Finaps, we operate with small teams capable of designing, building, and managing our clients’ business solutions. We believe our people are our greatest asset.



We have integrated the traditional roles and responsibilities within the IT chain, eliminating distinctions between consultants, developers, or scrum masters. We are all engineers, working collectively to achieve more than we ever could individually.



We believe that information technology can empower businesses to reach their goals. To achieve this, we rely on highly creative and talented individuals who can inspire clients by developing robust, data-driven, and software-based solutions.


At Finaps, we operate in small teams responsible for client interactions and delivering effective software and data solutions.



If you’re eager to engage in meaningful work and make a real impact for our clients, we’d love to hear from you. Reach out to us!


**“Our people are our greatest asset”**
---------------------------------------


**Is this you?**
----------------


* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in a beta study (mathematics, computer science, econometrics, …)
* At least 3 years of working experience in data analytics in the last 5 years
* [general] Knowledge about: Git, Agile (Scrum), Azure DevOps, Project Management
* [data engineering] Knowledge about: Python, ARM Templates, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps CI/CD Pipelines
* [data analytics] Knowledge about: SQL, Power BI
* You have experience with bringing data driven solutions (data pipelines, Power BI dashboards) into production
* You have taken a lead role in creating a solution design for a new project, proposing a major (technical) change in an already existing project and/or completing a project from start to finish
* It is nice to have one or more of the following certificates
	+ AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
	+ DP-900: Microsoft Azure Data Fundamentals
	+ DP-203: Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
	+ PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst
**This is who we are**
----------------------


* We are determined
* We are limitless
* We are collaborative
* We are proud of what we do and the solutions that we deliver

title: Data Consultant People Insights
description:
**Over deze vacature**  


Bij Achmea willen we als werkgever onze (potentiële) collega’s net zo’n onvergetelijke ervaring geven als onze klanten. Die ervaring gaan we realiseren door ons op medewerkersreizen te richten. Dat betekent voor HR dat we bewegen van expertise naar experience. Zo worden we samen slimmer én sneller van waarde voor onze medewerkers. Als Data Consultant bij het team Insights help je collega’s van ons People Experience Center (PEC) en management met het optimaliseren van de medewerkersreizen en het maken van de juiste tactische en strategische beslissingen.  

Wat ga jij doen?
* Je ontwikkelt performance metingen en KPI’s zodat we de medewerkersreizen kunnen meten en je zorgt ervoor dat dit leidt tot actiegerichte inzichten voor het PEC om deze medewerkersreizen te optimaliseren.
* Je initieert of analyseert vraagstukken die volgen uit het realiseren van de People Strategy van Achmea voor bijvoorbeeld de HR directie. Dit doe je door inzichten te halen uit een grote hoeveelheid data en databronnen met behulp van geavanceerde (statistische) methoden en technieken zoals machine learning en AI.
* Je signaleert mogelijkheden om de People Experience te verbeteren en maakt kansen voor HR concreet. Je schakelt met collega’s van de afdeling People Strategy en natuurlijk het PEC en adviseert stakeholders binnen en buiten de HR kolom.
* Je visualiseert je inzichten door een goede storyline en jouw onderbouwde analyses. Door jouw visualisaties en presentaties begrijpen jouw stakeholders wat de mogelijkheden zijn.
* Je challenget de collega’s in het Insights team en in het PEC op hun fact based werkwijze.
**De afdeling**  


In het team Insights werk je samen met 8 collega data experts (data engineers, data scientists en data consultants). Iedereen in het team heeft een passie voor het leveren van data gedreven oplossingen en vooral dat je dit het beste samen en met humor kunt realiseren. Je zult veel samenwerken met collega’s uit het People Experience Center om de medewerkersreizen te optimaliseren voor een ultieme Experience van onze medewerkers. Doordat we nauw met het PEC samenwerken hebben we direct impact op alle Achmea medewerkers met onze analyses en adviezen op basis van data.  

  

De standplaats van het team is Apeldoorn, maar werken tijd- en plaats onafhankelijk: we zijn op kantoor als het moet en werken thuis als het kan. In de praktijk kiezen we ervoor om minimaal 2 dagen per week gezamenlijk op kantoor te zijn**Jouw achtergrond**  

Je begrijpt de technische inhoud en kan de vertaling maken naar de collega’s buiten het eigen vakgebied. Je wil op zoveel mogelijk medewerkers zoveel mogelijk impact hebben en denkt daarom vanuit het perspectief van de medewerker. Je bent iemand die graag samen met anderen aan een oplossing werkt. Dat is niet alleen leuker, maar daar worden de oplossing en jijzelf alleen maar beter van!

  

* Daarnaast ben je iemand die van aanpakken houdt, een conceptuele denker die initiatief neemt en creatieve oplossingen aandraagt, analytisch, leergierig en communicatief is. Je hebt een sterke drive om complexe vraagstukken op te lossen met grote impact op de medewerkers van Achmea. Je bent een goede gesprekspartner voor HR-collega’s en analisten in de divisies van Achmea.Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding waardoor je kennis hebt van data analyse en minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in het analytics domein;
* Je hebt ervaring met werken op het Microsoft Azure platform (Synapse en PowerBI) en programmeertalen zoals Python en SQL;
* Je bent in staat om de échte vraag helder te krijgen. Dat doe je door te luisteren, door te vragen en je te verdiepen in de context;
* Je vindt het leuk om complexe (data)vraagstukken op te lossen en denkt daarbij vanuit het grote geheel. Daar blijft het niet bij: je wil ook graag de oplossing helpen;
* Jij weet welk verhaal je moet vertellen: van HR professional tot aan senior management, jouw stakeholders krijgen de informatie die ze nodig hebben voor de juiste beslissingen;
* Ervaring met Agile werken en affiniteit met het HR domein is een pre.
**Wat krijg je van ons**  

  

Als medewerker bij Achmea zet jij je elke dag in voor een gezonde, veilige én duurzame toekomst. En daar belonen we je graag voor! Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons een goed salaris, een mooie pensioenregeling mét lage eigen bijdrage (3,25%), 136 verlofuren (op basis van 34 uur per week) én korting op onze verzekeringen.
  

Maar er is meer!

 **34-urige werkweek**  

Een 34-urige werkweek is bij Achmea de standaard! Je werkt dan bijvoorbeeld 4 dagen van 8,5 uur. Zo heb je nóg meer tijd voor vrijwilligerswerk, een goed boek, mantelzorg óf jouw favoriete sport!

 **All You Can Learn**  

Onder de noemer All You Can Learn volg je opleidingen, cursussen en trainingen. De wereld van leren en ontwikkelen ligt bij ons aan je voeten!  



  

**Klimaatbudget**  


Ben je langer dan 12 maanden in dienst? Dan krijg je €2.500 netto klimaatbudget (bij fulltime dienstverband) om je huis te verduurzamen, duurzaam witgoed te kopen óf bijvoorbeeld een elektrische fiets aan te schaffen. Dit bedrag is bedoeld voor producten en diensten die een bijdrage leveren aan verduurzaming en verbetering van het milieu. **Healthy initiatieven**  

Gezond werken vinden we belangrijk, dus zorgen we ook dat dit kan met een berg healthy initiatieven!  



  

**Persoonlijk keuzebudget**  

Je ontvangt maandelijks een persoonlijk keuzebudget, opgebouwd uit 8% vakantietoeslag, 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering en 3,85% bovenwettelijk verlof. Je kiest zelf op welk moment je dit budget laat uitbetalen, je het gebruikt voor verlofsparen of dat je er vakantie-uren van koopt.  



  

**Over Achmea**  

Achmea staat voor Duurzaam Samen Leven. Een inclusieve samenleving waarin iedereen meedoet en plezierig en gezond met en naast elkaar leeft, is ons ideaalbeeld. Op een manier die langdurig kan voortbestaan. Goede reden om beter met onze leefomgeving om te gaan en duurzame oplossingen beter bereikbaar te maken. Voor iedereen!

 **Sollicitatieprocedure**  

* **Binnen 5 werkdagen reactie**
Of er een volgende stap wordt gezet (en zo ja, welke), weet jij al binnen 5 werkdagen.
* **Het 1e gesprek**
Tijdens onze 1e ontmoeting maken we kennis en bespreken we wat wij voor elkaar kunnen betekenen.
* **Een assessment**
Nieuwsgierig als we zijn, willen wij meteen van alles van je weten. Via je device thuis vul je een online assessment in.
* **Het 2e gesprek**
In een 2e gesprek zetten we de puntjes op de i en beantwoorden we de laatste vragen. Zo weten we beiden waar we aan beginnen.
* **Arbeidsovereenkomst**
Allebei even enthousiast!? Samen met jouw toekomstige manager zet je alle afspraken over het werken bij Achmea op een rij.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
As a Senior Data Engineer with Appsbroker CTS, you’ll design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that enable the efficient processing and analysis of large, complex data sets.


If you have an interest in working on innovative projects with cutting edge technology using Google Cloud Platform, this job could be a great opportunity for you.

### **Responsibilities:**

**Develop and maintain automated data processing pipelines using Google Cloud:**

* Design, build, and maintain data pipelines to support data ingestion, ETL, and storage
* Build and maintain automated data pipelines to monitor data quality and troubleshoot issues

**Implement and maintain databases and data storage solutions:**

* Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in big data and data engineering
* Ensure data quality, accuracy, and completeness

**Implement and enforce data governance policies and procedures to ensure data quality and accuracy:**

* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to design and optimise data models for analytical and reporting purposes
* Develop and maintain data models to support analytics and reporting
* Monitor and maintain data infrastructure to ensure availability and performance

**Requirements**

### **Key Skills:**

* Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.
* Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive.
* Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL tools such as Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, or Apache Airflow.
* Proficiency in at least one programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and in a team environment.

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* Private healthcare scheme
* Company pension
* Flexible working culture
* Market leading paid holiday entitlement
* Company events - opportunities to meet colleagues you don’t see every day
* Regular opportunities for industry recognised training and certifications
* Learning and development opportunities
* Opportunities to develop within a fast growing-tech business with ambitious growth and impact goals

### **Location:**


This role can be either fully remote or hybrid based depending on your preference. We have an office in Utrecht city centre, which you can choose to work from as often as you like. There is no mandatory office working, but you might be expected to travel to offices or customer sites for specific meetings or events.

### **Our Culture:**


CTS and Appsbroker have agreed a strategic merger, joining forces to become the largest Google Cloud-only digital consultancy in Europe. We’re looking for bright, passionate people to join us at the vanguard, delivering the most ambitious Google Cloud projects across AI, security, martech, data, and Workspace.


Our culture and values are really important to us. We invest strongly in our people, and our culture is down-to-earth, approachable, energetic, bright, and helpful.


In uniting our team of over 400 best-in-class experts, we now have a fantastic opportunity to build on our collective heritage and grow an even better company, with an even more dynamic, creative, and diverse culture from which to learn from one another and serve our customers. We want ambitious people to join us who can help us with this mission.


As part of our values, we believe in business with a positive impact, and we’re mindful of the way our company connects with the world around it. We’re a certified B Corporation and our commitment to sustainability shapes what we do and how we do it - from the way we work with our customers to how we nurture and develop our talented community.

title: Trainee Developer
description:
**Job Name:** Trainee Developer

**Job Location:** Amsterdam, Netherlands

**Experience Range:** 0-1 Years

**Joining Date:** 1st September 2024

**About TCS:** 

TCS creates digital advantage for businesses and societies. We are a leading digital services, software and consulting company with global capabilities serving Finnish Customer. Our values and heritage are the foundation of our success.

We serve more than 20 customers in Finland and 1500 across the globe. Diversity and Inclusion are our core values. Our workforce has more than 38% women and representation from more than 150 nationalities. With us you have a great possibility to see the whole spectrum of the IT field! In our team you can decide whether you prefer growing as an expert in some specific domain or whether you want to gain wide experience in different business areas.

**Let's build a brighter future Together.**

We at TCS are expanding our capabilities in serving our customers in their software development needs related to customer specific information systems. We are looking for skilled full stack developers/Support Engineers to join our team. Our teams work with technologies such as Data Analytics, Cloud, React, Salesforce, Angular, Blazor, React, and Vue. Cloud is strongly present in majority of our customer projects.

We are looking for someone who wants to work with us on a permanent basis as Trainee Developer. With us you would be working closely not only with software, but with your team members and customers as well, and often with colleagues from other companies, too.

We work in a Hybrid Work environment with primary location as Amsterdam.

**Skills And Characteristics Needed in the Role**

* Capability and willingness to teamwork
* Capability and willingness to direct customer interaction
* Genuine interest to keep technical know-how up to date
* Recent Graduate in STEM Subjects Prefered 2023-2024 Students.
* Fluent Dutch and English

**Note:** **Joining date for Trainee developer is 01st September 2024**

**What’s in it for you?**

* You can genuinely impact the future by working in meaningful projects. You get to influence how digitalization serves millions of Finns, today and tomorrow. You will be working with some of the biggest Finnish companies in gaining state-of-the-art digital advantage against their rivals in the global competition more your thing?
* Startup spirit and benefits of a big company – with us you get the best of both worlds. You get to work in an agile way. Since you will be working with customer directly you get the responsibility to make many decisions as in any start-up community. We ensure you stability with long-term and maintain the vibrancy with large range of projects/technologies to choose from. Competitive compensation and a great work-life balance is ensured.

If you would be interested in the role, drop me a note here/at **vinithkumar.r@tcs.com**

Job Types: Full-time, Internship, New-Grad, Permanent  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: From €35.000,00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Why you are looking for this job? Are you recent Graduate? Brief Intro needed.

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Language:

* Dutch (Required)

Work authorization:

* Netherlands (Required)

Application Deadline: 30/08/2024  
Expected Start Date: 01/09/2024

title: Network Automation Engineer
description:
### **Working for the Most Prominent Companies**


If you find it challenging to work for the largest and most prominent companies in the world, optimizing and securing their networks, then you will certainly find your place at this organization. They are a leading European player where top-tier companies turn to for managed services, security, and innovation.

### **Leading the Way to Automate Network Management**


Currently, several projects are underway from client organizations that want to use network automation to improve and optimize network management. This will enhance their service delivery and allow more attention to be given to security.

### **An Important Task for a Mature Engineer**


As an automation expert, you will join the team. You will discuss expectations with the team lead and then start working independently. You will participate in team meetings and regularly report back to the team lead.


You will work fully remotely by UK timezone. Occasionally, you might be asked to travel to the UK for critical meetings. One important requirement is that you live in a GDPR territory.

### **Your Profile**


Experience with the Juniper Paragon suite is mandatory. Additionally, you should meet the following requirements:

* Strong programming skills in Python.
* Knowledge of Juniper Paragon Suite, Kafka, Netbox, and experience with Prometheus and Elasticsearch for monitoring and data analytics.
* Experience with network automation tools such as Itential IAG and IAP, and familiarity with API design using platforms like Kong API.
* Proficiency in handling network configuration changes for various router types and service reflectors.
* Expertise in Kubernetes and Docker for container orchestration and deployment.
* Strong understanding of GNMI protocols and network inventory management.

### **Responsibilities**

* Develop and maintain automation scripts, APIs, and data streaming services, integrating Prometheus for monitoring and Elasticsearch for detailed logging and analytics.
* Handle device configurations and modifications, such as PE routers, P routers, BGP-LS routers, and Internet Route Reflectors.
* Develop and maintain operational dashboards using data from Prometheus and Elasticsearch to track and optimize network operations.
* Work on the MACD activation framework and manage the lifecycle of code changes and regressions within the NaaS environments.

### **Remuneration**


A serious job requires a serious reward. We offer a B2B contract based on a fixed monthly amount or an hourly rate. The project is for at least 6 months, but we expect it to be extended for a much longer period.

### **Interested?**


Please fill in the form and answer our questions to make the process as quick and painless as possible. It is only useful to apply if you:

* Live in a GDPR territory (most of Europe)
* Are fluent in English (oral and written)
* Are ready to have multiple video calls during the application process
* Are ready to prove your identity and do not object to a security check
* Are able to provide references

title: Dev Ops Engineer
description:
Leveraging your passion for data in supporting Rabobank’s data driven ambitions. To support all business initiatives with a need for data (structured and unstructured, high volume and/or streaming), Rabobank has implemented a Global Data & Analytics Platform (GDAP) in the cloud. One of the key characteristics of this GDAP is the concept of self-service: both producers and consumers of data should be able to use the platform in a self-service way. Our team is the single point of entry for the whole enterprise to engage in getting value out of data by using the platform.  

You advise data producer and consumer teams on how to efficiently make use of this platform. You are the point of contact for teams using the GDAP and assist in setting up their Azure specific resources and advise on topics like data processing, data quality and data governance. You are the analyst with great communication skills focussing on both functional as well as Azure technical requirements.  

As we are still at the start of our GDAP journey you can contribute in shaping the GDAP by bringing your broad experience in the data domain and translate the feedback of our users into requirements to develop the platform. You can help to further refine the onboarding process of the GDAP and advise the organisation in becoming a Data-as-a-Service organisation.

**Impact**


As an Azure Cloud Support Engineer GDAP you make a difference by:

* Understanding the goals and needs of the business as no other. You are able to understand the question behind the question and translate that into requirements.
* Translating the requirements into solutions using the GDAP. You understand the concepts and solutions forming the GDAP.
* Being the (wo)man in the middle between our tenants (data providers, data producers and data consumers) and the various DevOps-teams of the GDAP. You are able to connect and communicate with a variety of stakeholders.
* Promoting the GDAP in the organization.
* Supporting our tenants with technical questions on Azure and incidents.

**Your talents**


Open communication, working together, providing feedback, being extremely customer focused and working in a structured way are key talents that a support engineer embodies.


Need to have

* At least 2 years of experience as an Azure engineer
* Strong communication skills
* At least certified on Azure Foundation AZ-900 and Azure Data Engineer Associate DP-203
* Willing to develop further in Azure knowledge
* Experience in complex data environments
* Consulting skills
* Experience with working in scrum/agile teams


Nice to have

* Experience in the Financial sector
* Experience with large scale organisations
* Experience in working with development teams as stakeholders
* Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104)

**Together**


As an Azure Cloud Support Engineer Global Data & Analytics Platform you will be part of the tribe Global Data & Analytics Platform. The tribe Global Data & Analytics Platform is empowering the Rabobank to develop and manage Data & Analytics solutions. Every day the squads of the tribe work on innovative solutions to help the Rabobank reach this goal. The members of the tribe continuously improve themselves and their squads. We openly share our different perspectives and our mistakes and we have an urge to getting things done right. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do.

**This is what we offer you**

* a gross monthly salary between €4.292,- and €6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week (40 hours possible)).
* 13th month and holiday pay: the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly instalments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* a monthly € 40,- net work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* a monthly € 40,- net internet allowance.
* Attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a DevOps Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.


You and the job application process

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Raphaël Drenthel, IT Recruiter,raphael.drenthel@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
What does it take to be an Observability Solution Engineer at Splunk?
This is an opportunity to work at a company that is changing the way information supports business decisions. At Splunk, we've grown rapidly across Europe by helping leading companies (including 90 of the Fortune 100) go from data to business outcomes faster than ever.
  

Join us on our journey as Splunk Solution Engineer, and enjoy a culture of inclusiveness, disruption, and fun while selling smart and winning big.
What’s the role of a Solution Engineer at Splunk?* You will technically own, discover, position, prove and deliver the key technical elements of a sales cycle to achieve a ‘technical win’ within large scale and complex customer environments. You’ll use a range of communication styles, a range of technology skills and experiences and a range of soft skills and people skills to develop trust relationships with both your sales colleagues and your customers.
* You will be an advocate and ambassador for Splunk through your professional social media, industry and marketing events and supporting pipeline generation activities
* You will collaborate with your customer contacts, and build them into Splunk champions, by helping them to understand how Splunk can help them to solve some of their most challenging problems and help them achieve their objectives.


Responsibilities:* Ability to demonstrate Splunk products and services to customers on site, remotely via webinar sessions, and at field events such as conferences and trade shows.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships throughout the sales cycle with all levels within the customer.
* Willing to travel to visit prospects and customers, and to engage in onsite customer work when required.
* Answer complex technical and competitive questions plus address customer concerns to a successful outcome.
* You should have experience with discovering pain and determining value with customers.
* You should be comfortable working for a dynamic technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base.


Do these characteristics describe YOU?* Curiosity: You tend to want to understand the why of a scenario as much as the what and typically use a range of skills to discover whether the first response to the question really describes the situation or its implications
* Customer Success: Selling is great, but customers being successful with your solutions is one of your main motivations.
* Technically Astute: You enjoy the detail, even if you don’t always need to express it. You have a thirst for up-to-date knowledge of the technologies and solutions that businesses use to be successful as they transform.
* Confidence: But not arrogant – you have the confidence that comes from the knowledge that your product is rock solid, and the ability to transmit this confidence to a customer. That means you might sit down with a customer already using your product to show them how they might use it even better!
* Business Savvy: You understand how businesses are organized, how they achieve their desired results, what challenges they are likely to face, what solutions they need and what transformations they could make with your solutions.
* A growth mindset: You build in time to develop your skills, knowledge, experience or capabilities. You look beyond the current opportunity towards the wider set of opportunities that could exist in a prospect.
* A Collaborator: You understand that selling is a team game, so you spend time developing your network of colleagues and partners to achieve your success – and theirs.
* Competitive: If you’re in it, you want to win it!
* Fun: Getting the job done and enjoying & generating fun don’t need to be mutually exclusive.
* The candidate must be based in the Netherlands and be fluent in Dutch and English.


Helpful technical skills or experience (not all required, but consider how Splunk could benefit from your background)* Domain knowledge and experience in any of the following areas: IT infrastructure, Cloud Technologies, Application Delivery, Business Analytics or Log Management
* Insights in IT Operations: Experience with ITSM tools and ITIL processes like incident, problem & change
* Understanding of IT Monitoring & Observability in all its aspects: logs, metrics and traces, experience with monitoring tools (Infrastructure and APM)
* Modern application architecture (microservices): Understanding or experience with working with Kubernetes, Docker, and/or Lambda/serverless


Understanding of DevOps concepts: Experience working in engineering/software development roles. Hands-on experience working with modern programming languages including: Java, Python, PHP, .NET, Ruby, js, Go, etc.
We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.


Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. Please note that the On Target Earnings (OTE) range is a guideline and for candidates who receive an offer, the OTE will vary based on factors such as work location as set out above, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. **In addition to OTE, this role may be eligible for equity or long-term cash awards.**


Benefits are an important part of Splunk's Total Rewards package. This role is eligible for a comprehensive, competitive benefits package which may include healthcare and retirement plans, paid time off, wellbeing expense reimbursement, and much more! Learn more about our comprehensive benefits and wellbeing offering at https://splunkbenefits.com.
